What information is contained in the "out" array in a Verus transaction?

The "out" array in a Verus transaction contains an array of JSON objects, each representing an output of the transaction. Each object has several properties:

* "value": the value of the output in VRSC
* "n": the index of the output
* "scriptPubKey": a JSON object containing information about the script pub key, including:
	+ "asm": the assembly code for the script
	+ "hex": the hexadecimal representation of the script
	+ "reqSigs": the number of required signatures
	+ "type": the type of script, such as "pubkeyhash"
	+ "addresses": an array of Komodo addresses associated with the script

out" : [       (array of json objects)
   {
    "value" : x.xxx,      (numeric) The value in VRSC
    "n" : n,          (numeric) index
    "scriptPubKey" : {     (json object)
     "asm" : "asm",     (string) the asm
     "hex" : "hex",     (string) the hex
     "reqSigs" : n,      (numeric) The required sigs
     "type" : "pubkeyhash", (string) The type, eg 'pubkeyhash'
     "addresses" : [      (json array of string)
      "komodoaddress"     (string) Komodo address
      ,...
     ]
    }
   }
   ,...
 ],
 "vjoinsplit" : [    (array of json objects, only for version >= 2)
   {
    "vpub_old" : x.xxx,     (numeric) public input value in KMD
    "vpub_new" : x.xxx,     (numeric) public output value in KMD
    "anchor" : "hex",     (string) the anchor
    "nullifiers" : [      (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) input note nullifier
     ,...
    ],
    "commitments" : [      (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) output note commitment
     ,...
    ],
    "onetimePubKey" : "hex", (string) the onetime public key used to encrypt the ciphertexts
    "randomSeed" : "hex",   (string) the random seed
    "macs" : [         (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) input note MAC
     ,...
    ],
    "proof" : "hex",     (string) the zero-knowledge proof
    "ciphertexts" : [      (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) output note ciphertext
     ,...
    ]
   }
   ,...
 ],
 "blockhash" : "hash",  (string) the block hash
 "confirmations" : n,   (numeric) The confirmations
 "time" : ttt,       (numeric) The transaction time in seco
What information is contained in the "blockhash" and "confirmations" properties of a Verus transaction?
The "blockhash" property contains the hash of the block in which the transaction was included, while the "confirmations" property contains the number of confirmations the transaction has received.

   {
    "value" : x.xxx,      (numeric) The value in VRSC
    "n" : n,          (numeric) index
    "scriptPubKey" : {     (json object)

     "reqSigs" : n,      (numeric) The required sigs
     "type" : "pubkeyhash", (string) The type, eg 'pubkeyhash'
     "addresses" : [      (json array of string)
      "komodoaddress"     (string) Komodo address
      ,...
     ]
    }
   }
   ,...
 ],

   {
    "vpub_old" : x.xxx,     (numeric) public input value in KMD
    "vpub_new" : x.xxx,     (numeric) public output value in KMD
    "anchor" : "hex",     (string) the anchor
    "nullifiers" : [      (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) input note nullifier
     ,...
    ],
    "commitments" : [      (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) output note commitment
     ,...
    ],
    "onetimePubKey" : "hex", (string) the onetime public key used to encrypt the ciphertexts
    "randomSeed" : "hex",   (string) the random seed
    "macs" : [         (json array of string)
     "hex"           (string) input note MAC
     ,...

    "proof" : "hex",     (string) the zero-knowledge proof
    "ciphertexts" : [      (json array of string)
